alert.note: Alert for Hayes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:34AM CDT until May 14 at 2:46AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in North Platte NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska... Frenchman Creek near Palisade affecting Hayes County. For the Frenchman Creek...including Palisade...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Frenchman Creek near Palisade. * WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Flooding begins between Wauneta and Palidade. Some areas of Palisade near Kotter Park will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Friday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet on 05/31/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM CDT.
